meanings.definition: Misadapts (verb): to fail to adjust or change appropriately
meanings.sent1: She misadapts to new situations easily.
meanings.sent2: He often misadapts to sudden changes in plans.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy robot misadapts to simple tasks, like pouring a glass of water.
meanings.sent4: Her old car misadapts to the demands of daily commuting.
meanings.sent5: The young tree misadapts to the harsh winter conditions, struggling to grow.

meanings.definition: Misadapts (noun): instances of failing to adjust or change appropriately
meanings.sent1: The misadapts in his life led to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent2: She kept a record of all the misadapts she encountered.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show highlighted the misadapts of a character trying to fit in.
meanings.sent4: The painting depicted the misadapts of a city struggling with modernization.
meanings.sent5: The book explored the misadapts of a society facing rapid technological advancements.
